subject: RE: [junit] Setting up database for unit testing
msgSnippet: You might want to take a look at DbUnit to see if it fits your needs. http://dbunit.sourceforge.net/ Jem... ... From: Robert Taylor
messageBody:
You might want to take a look at DbUnit to see if it fits your needs.

http://dbunit.sourceforge.net/

Jem...


-----Original Message-----
From: Robert Taylor [mailto:rtaylor@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 01, 2004 8:34 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Setting up database for unit testing


Greetings, I would like to prepare (populate) a database for unit
testing some DAO classes. After executing the unit tests, I would
like to restore the database (delete any records created during testing).

Is there an open source tool to do this.
I need something that can just read and execute SQL in a file.
Can I do this with Torque? Are there other tools that are easier to
work with?

robert
